info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 12 at 6:31PM CDT until July 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern DuPage County in northeastern Illinois... Northwestern Cook County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 630 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing 2 tornadoes, one near South Elgin and another near Valley View. Both were moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These dangerous storms will be near... Hoffman Estates, Bartlett, Wayne and Dupage Airport around 635 PM CDT. West Chicago around 640 PM CDT. Streamwood and Carol Stream around 645 PM CDT. Hanover Park, Glendale Heights and Bloomingdale around 650 PM CDT. Schaumburg and Roselle around 655 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
